reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Been using these smart switches for 2 to 3 years. All 20 switches are all used to control lights. Loved them at first BUT like many other reviews they have started to fail. They would mysteriously turn on my lights, and there will be no way to turn them off. They are also not straightforward to setup to be recognized on the app. I just bought another 4-pack of 3-way switches to fix another two failed switches. Judging from the reviews I think I am going to be moving away from TreatLife, if anymore of them fail.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025
reviews.title: Disappointed after 2+ years...

reviews.text: I have bought quite a few Treatlife switches and smart devices and none of them have lasted longer than 2 years. These are by far the worst smart devices I own. I have purchases, single pole, 3 way, dimmers, fan controllers and all the devices seem to stop working after about 2 years. The plastic is also very poor quality and begins to break down and become very brittle. I recommend going with a more reputable brand for your smart devices.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2024
reviews.title: Very Poor Quality, and Do Not Last Long.

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I recently embarked on a large home renovation project and decided to install smart switches for all my lights, ordering 20 TreatLife switches, along with multiple 2-gang and 3-gang wall plates. Unfortunately, this decision turned into the biggest headache of the project. During installation, my electricians discovered that the TreatLife smart 3-way switches didn’t work with the other TreatLife 3-way switches and would need to be paired with non-smart switches. The lights would randomly go to the dimmest setting. Worse, I had no choice in which side the smart switch went on due to existing wiring, leading to awkward placements where smart switches were alone, and non-smart switches were grouped with others—resulting in a messy, unattractive look (see images). I contacted TreatLife, and while each response took a day or more, they finally confirmed that their 3-way smart switches only work with 3-way non-smart switches, WHICH THEY DON’T EVEN MAKE! Not very smart for a ‘smart’ switch company. They offered no solution for the mismatched look, and to top it off, refused to accept returns on the unopened switches that would not work with their other switches as it had been over 30 days. I ultimately found a solution with Lutron Caseta switches, which allow two matching switches on either side of the 3-way configuration through an innovative remote that can be installed to look just like the hard-wired switch while allowing way more flexibility with installation locations since no wiring is needed for the remote side. The result? A seamless, functional setup I love. While it required an additional investment and another electrician visit, the new system is worth every penny. If you want matching switches for your 3-way lights, STAY AWAY FROM TREATLIFE!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
reviews.title: If you want matching switches for your 3-way lights, STAY AWAY FROM TREATLIFE!

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I bought #4 of these three way smart switches in August 2021. #1 switch has failed since last year but I did not replace it because the other 3 way switch for that light is in a convenient location. Then another started being eratic just like how the first one had started and then completely failed. I have tried everything like reseting the switch to add it again but it would not even do that, even tried rewiring but to no avail. looks like they all have a short life of 1.5 to 3 years max because now as of today all #4 switches have failed and I cannot even use them manually to turn on/off the lights, I have to use the manual switch on the other end of the #3way to control the lights. I gave Three star because they are good when they work but don't expect them to last long and you would have to replace them every 2 to 3 years.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024
reviews.title: They start to fail after a years - will last 1 to 3 years

reviews.title: Not a good product.

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I have 5 of these around my house on 3 way light circuits. I really like them because they are easy to install, respond well to Alexa and are simple to use both manually and via wifi. However, they do not last very long. A regular 3 way switch will last for decades without any problem. I have had to replace 3 of these in 3 years. Two were covered under the warranty; the latest one is one year out of warranty and Treatlife will not replace it. It appears on Alexa ask the Treatlife app as being offline, the indicator light is no longer lit and it will not turn the light off or on manually. Treatlife customer service provided some troubleshooting suggestions but that's all. They will not stand behind their product because it's 1 year out of warranty. Of course, we're not talking about a lot of money but when you're dealing with an electrical device you've got to consider other implications of a failure. Will it simply stop working, as this and the others did, or is there something else wrong that could cause a fire or other damage if it isn't noticed in time. These are "FCC certified," I suppose because they transmit a Wifi signal, but there is no indication of a UL Listing . I will look for better alternatives.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
reviews.title: Very nice but then they fail within a few years

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I bought (4) 3-way in 2019 and (4) single in 2020 Spring of last year none of the 3-way worked but all Single Pole did. The 3-ways, I lost 2 within a year and a half, lost another a year later and lost the last one last summer. This purchase was to replace the ones that died, so until I have a chance to see how long they last, I am sticking with 3-stars. If I was judging the Single Pole switch, I would rate them 5 stars as those have worked exactly as expected and have been working for over 4 year with an Alexa interface. *** UPDATE *** When the company read my review, they did offer to replace the switches that went bad, again, I like the look and feel of these switches, so I am hoping to have a better experience with the new ones.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
reviews.title: Need to wait and see

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Update on November 2024 Also, how many time I have to reset ALL of the switches every time after the power blinking or power outage??? it makes everything such a 3rd world. I purchased bunches in 2021 for a new contraction house. A few were defectives but they wouldn’t listen to me at first when I called their customer service, I had put my electrician on the phone speaking with them and then finally they agreed to send me replacement. After that, everything was fine for the first 2 years. The function of the switches started get crazy since last year, some switches turn on automatically after power outages or blinking and they can’t be turned off by APP, I have to reset them every single time. If we’re out of town the lights are all on till we get home to reset everything. It gets worse this year, some of them just turn on repeatedly right after I turn them off, I couldn’t turn them off so I had reset those switches and delete them from my APP, when I trying to reset them they were all dead, so I had to replace them from my stock that I purchased 3 years ago, then found out that they were discolored, unless I change the whole panel of switches otherwise the color doesn’t much here and there. So these switches life spans are about 3 years. the switch itself is not expansive but it definitely is expansive for only last 3 years.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
reviews.title: Review after 3 years

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Didnt know that a company like Treatlife would sell used smart switches . Two out four had wires which are cut, one didn not work at all, the fourth one was not smooth to press and there was dust along all the 4 switches clearly showing it was a used product and no quality check was done. AVOID this. I got an electrician come over to install the switches for which he said he will charge $60 per switch. He installed the first two and when it was time to turn it on it, only 1 worked but required to press hard. So we thought maybe we thought 1 switch was faulty and design of other had problems. So i thought to use the third one and then i saw the cut wires for both of them!! My electrician replaced back the original switches but would still charge me $120. Now even thought TreatLife would accept the return, i paid 2.5 times the cost of this switch without getting any benefit ☹️☹️☹️ And yeah, there was no manual!!!! So just avoid it at all cost. I dont know if i can ever buy a Treatlife product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2024
reviews.title: Crap and used

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Installed two of them on 2-way circuit (only one switching location) and they worked, which is the only reason I'm giving the item 2 stars. Installed one on a 3- way circuit (2 switching locations) and one on a 4- way circuit (3 switching locations). The switches worked mechanically, toggled the light on and off manually, and also toggled through the app. However, the app would not show the lights were on, which means if you are remote, you don't know whether they are on or not, and Alexa cannot turn them off since it thinks they are always off. Customer service was useless in helping. Suggested uninstalling and reinstalling from the app, changing light bulbs and switching traveler wires, none of which worked. On my own, I moved the switches from the line side to the load side, and that didn't help. Final say from customer service was "the switches are incompatible with your 3-way circuit", which is crap, all 3- way circuits have the same wiring. Ended up replacing the switches with dimmers, which worked just fine. So, their 2-way and 3-way dimmers and 2-way switches work great, but the 3- way switches don't work.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
reviews.title: 2 out of 2 did not work on 3-way and 4-way circuits

They lasted great for a little less than 3 years before just completely not working.

reviews.text: We’ve enjoyed having several TreatLife products for the last 3 years. Most of our home has smart lights and switches throughout, and after an unfortunate 2 wired switches stopped working, we decided to contact customer support. While the team could have easily dismissed our concerns, they thoughtfully asked for every detail to ascertain the problem. When a solve was not apparent, they quickly shipped replacements free of charge. I will definitely continue to recommend TreatLife products, and I’m sure we’ll be a longtime customer.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service!

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I like the TreatLife line of products, but have had trouble with there three way switches providing proper ON-OFF indication in the app for circuits with longer wiring runs. They always indicate they are off. This makes it impossible to set up automation to turn the lights off or give commands via Alexa, Google,etc. TreatLife doesn’t publish specs on max wiring length. However, I have seen post in home automation threads where works run into the same problem. TreatLife tech support has also confirmed that wire length could prevent issues. TP-Link 3 way switches have the same issue. I had to go with Leviton for my 3 way circuits which requires every switch in the circuit to be changed out and gets pricey. I stil prefer to use TreatLife for all my single pole applications do to the significant cost savings and the products are good.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.title: Issues with longer circuits

reviews.text: I ordered multiple of same exact model in 2021 and flashed with Tasmota for use with HomeAssistant. Unfortunately, the internals have changed with no model change. The ones bought in 2021 used to have the TYWE3S and now they have WB3S. Latter is not Tasmota flashable. There are some posts of replacing the chip, but that is too much of a hassle. Rating it as 5 star as I assume they work OK with cloud Tuya.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.title: Used have the TYWE3S, now has the Now with WB3S. No longer Tasmota compatible

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Purchased these to replace standard 3-way switch. They installed easily and worked well at first, but a year later they start to fail. Issue is there comes a time where they no longer accept your pressing the switch to turn ON. You first notice you press to turn ON and 5-seconds later the lights turn OFF. Next, it takes a long press (3-seconds) for the switch to accept the input to turn ON (and you must do the same to turn OFF). Another tell tale sign is asking Alexa to turn ON or OFF, and 5-seconds later the switch performs the opposite. I've replaced these with the KASA brand switch which from my experience have been very dependable.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.title: Won't last over time

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Absolutely love the Treatlife brand products. I have slowly but surely put these Wi-Fi switches and outlets in my whole house. This new 3-way switch is fantastic. You can use this switch either as a standard single pole or a three-way circuit. It's nice that you can put one at the end of the circuit and use a standard 3-way switch on the other end of the circuit. You do not need to be an electrician to install these, the instructions are easy to follow. They're constantly improving the app at the suggestion of their customer needs. Between the App and Alexa, you can achieve any programming you need. A++
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.title: Putting these in my whole house!

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I spent $850 over the course of a year changing all my switches to Treatlife products to manager dozens of recessed can lights, bathroom fans, ceiling fans, etc. With so many switches and kids, I thought it would be great to be able to dim the massive amount of can lights and also control them to keep lights all over the house from being left on. The theory is great but the switches are not. I have fought several to keep them on the network constantly resetting them. Several have been replaced. Several are not working now and I had to put the old toggle switches back into one fixture. I have a mesh network so signal is never a problem. Every time we have a power outage of any sort, many get messed up and have to be reconnected to the network / app. The newest versions I bought as replacements are even harder to get online since they “automated” the process. I have 2 that cannot be synced and are brand new. 3 out of the 4 fan light combination switches have failed. Naturally some that I have the most trouble with are in the basement and I have to go down to turn off one switch out of 3 that my kids left on even after using the app to turn off ALL basement lights. I contacted Treatlife about some of these issues and they wanted me to go thru all the programming steps and tell them what happens at each step. I explained it is not even turning on so I cannot make it do anything. Then they said I must have made a mistake wiring them. I am an engineer and have wired several houses and barns including fixing others mistakes. This is all run around to avoid warranty claims. They won’t stand behind the high failure rate products. My advice is to limit your installations to only devices that benefit from connectivity and avoid the headache and expense of such a buggy system. Definitely not worth the hype for a whole home install. And definitely not worth a wife being upset the lights or ceiling fan is not working.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.title: Not worth the headache

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Customer service is the best because of all the switches that I have bought from treatlife only one has gone out and they chose to warranty it and replace it and keep me a customer for life. Hard to find companies like that. 5 stars and have my business as long as their products stay high quality. Thanks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.title: Customer service is the best

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: The three-way switch worked as advertised for the first week and then it failed. I did troubleshooting to make sure it was actually the switch. It was so I reached out to the manufacturer. They respond once with troubleshooting tips I did the troubleshooting. There was no further communication form the manufacturer they do not stand behind their product I would avoid this manufacturer.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.title: No support

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Needed to reinstall switch to another location. Switch did not have rapidly blinking light. Tried resetting switch per installation instructions ( disconnect power to switch,wait 10 sec., reconnect power,hold down reset for 5sec&-->NO BLINKING LIGHT just a solid orange light tried this MANY TIMES. I bought a 4 pack & 3 of them exhibit this behavior DO NOT BUY.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.title: 3-way Switch will NOT reset

reviews.text: Easy to install, pair easy to the app. Use a different brand wall plate if you have a multi switch location.

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I installed these things throughout the house a little over 2 years ago. In the past few months, two of them have failed altogether and will not respond to the programming procedure, so now I will have to replace them. Fortunate that I'm able to do my own electrical work otherwise I'd be paying an electrician to replace some switches. I expect something like this to be good for more than just a few years.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.title: Good, but don't last long

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: I tried to get support from their help line. I gave them several days to reach me to help. Nothing. I was the electrician for my home, thus know what I’m doing. Lights don’t turn off when scheduled. App makes it difficult to understand if lights are even on or off. Don’t buy.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
reviews.title: Doesn’t fully work. App functionality poor

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Purchase these in July 2020 1 went out in early 2023 and another one today .. August 2023 and they make a electrical sound That's a little scary .. also when I got with the seller I warranty was up so I bought another set because I have a lot upstairs and downstairs .. if this continue I will just have to take my loss and swap the switches I'm guessing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.title: Maybe do not get these

reviews.productTitle: TREATLIFE 3 Way Smart Light Switch 4 Pack, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Smart Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, Neutral Wire Required, Remote Control, FCC Certified, No Hub Required
reviews.text: Looking on the company’s site, the 3 -way dimmer (DS02) and 3-way switch (SS02) are compatible but they I cannot get them to work together. There is no wiring diagram attached to the product or on the company’s site. I spoke with the company and they say that all their smart 3 way switch must have only one smart switch as a master switch. The second switch must be mechanical/regular! This is in contract to the installation drawing that show two SS02 (or similar) on the same circuit….. I managed only to operate the dimmer with regular 3-way switch (mechanical).
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
reviews.title: Don’t buy! Missing electrical diagram.
